taskDescription: The aconitase-catalyzed addition of water to cis-aconitate in the citric acid cycle occurs with the following stereochemistry. Does the addition of the OH group occur on the Re or Si face of the substrate? What about the addition of the H? Do the H and OH groups add from the same side of the double bond or from opposite sides?
detailedSolution: The −OH adds to the Re face of C2, and −H adds to the Re face of C3. The overall addition has anti stereochemistry.
